Package farmSim

Class FarmSimulatorApp

java.lang.Object
farmSim.FarmSimulatorApp
public class FarmSimulatorApp
extends java.lang.Object
GUI and driving class for farm simulator application.
Version:
10/05/2020
Author:
James Harris, Manjeet Panwar

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    FarmSimulatorApp()
    Create the application.

  • Constructor Details

    • FarmSimulatorApp

      public FarmSimulatorApp()
      Create the application.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Launch Application. Create GUI window and create event queue
      Parameters:
      args - contains command-line arguments passed to the Java program upon invocation

    • checkValidSetupScreenInputs

      public void checkValidSetupScreenInputs()
      Checks whether the setUpScreen User inputs are valid. If valid calls setUpGameState with values from data entry fields on setup screen

    • setUpGameState

      public void setUpGameState​(int numOfDays, java.lang.String farmerName, java.lang.String farmName, java.lang.String farmType)
      Sets the gameState to a new GameState object using passed in parameters. Updates gameEnv gameState to this gameState Calls changeToMainGameScreen then buildShopScreen
      Parameters:
      numOfDays - The number of days the fame should last
      farmerName - The name of the farmer
      farmName - The name of the farm
      farmType - The type of the farm

    • changeToMainGameScreen

      public void changeToMainGameScreen()
      Changes the current panel the main game panel. Hides other panels. Calls update main screen

    • updateMainScreen

      public void updateMainScreen()
      Updates all fields on main screen. Including money label, actions remaining label, day label, animal pens, actions panel, and crop farms. Then validates and repaints main screen.

    • goNextDay

      public void goNextDay()
      Calls gameEnv to check if game can progress to next day. If it can, calls gameEnv to process next day and updates main screen Otherwise calls gameEnd

    • changeToShopScreen

      public void changeToShopScreen()
      Changes the current panel the shop panel. Hides main game panel, Resets shop header, calls update shop screen

    • updateShopScreen

      public void updateShopScreen()
      Updates all fields on main screen. Fields: shopMoneyLabel shopOnwedItemsTextPane shopOwnedCropsTextPane shopOwnedAnimalsTextPane

    • buildShopScreen

      public void buildShopScreen()
      Retrieve static descriptions of different purchasable classes and change shop displays to them.

    • purchaseFromShop

      public void purchaseFromShop​(int panel)
      Takes the integer referring to a shop panel attempting to be purchased from. If class of purchase animal: calls gameEnv to check if there is space for new animal, calls gameEnv to check if there is enough money for new animal. If so calls gameEnv to purchase animal, otherwise calls unpurchaseable() with reason purchase couldn't be completed If class of purchase crop: calls gameEnv to check if there is space for new crop, calls gameEnv to check if there is enough money for new crop. If so calls gameEnv to purchase crop, otherwise calls unpurchaseable() with reason purchase couldn't be completed If class of purchase item: calls gameEnv to check if there is enough money for new item. If so calls gameEnv to purchase item, otherwise calls unpurchaseable() with reason purchase couldn't be completed Then calls update shop screen
      Parameters:
      panel - The integer referring to the panel purchased from

    • unpurchaseable

      public void unpurchaseable​(java.lang.String reason)
      Called if shop item was unpurchaseable. Sets shop header to reason item was unpurchaseable
      Parameters:
      reason - The text to update the shop header to

    • updateAnimalPens

      public void updateAnimalPens()
      Updates the Animals pens by checking the number of animals in the farm. For each animal on the farm, gets the animals type, then updates the icon and description of the corresponding pen to those of the animal type.

    • checkActionSelected

      public void checkActionSelected()
      Determines which of the action button is selected. Calls other methods as appropriate.

    • removeActionButtons

      public void removeActionButtons()
      Removes all action buttons from action button group.

    • generateActionButtons

      public void generateActionButtons()
      Populate the action buttons panel with radio buttons corresponding to the actions currently available to the user First removes all currently displayed radio buttons. Then has gameEnv check if different actions are performable If they are, adds corresponding buttons to action button panel. Updates main action label to whether or not users can perform actions

    • playWithAnimals

      public void playWithAnimals()
      Calls gameEnv play with animals then updates main screen.

    • generateItemSubOptions

      public void generateItemSubOptions​(java.lang.String[] itemTypes, java.lang.String message)
      Populate the action buttons panel with radio buttons which represent the items the user can use. Then update the message above the actions list
      Parameters:
      itemTypes - the type of items to present to the user
      message - the message to be displayed

    • feedAnimals

      public void feedAnimals​(java.lang.String itemToFeed)
      Calls gameEnv feed animals and passes itemToFeed. Then calls update main screen
      Parameters:
      itemToFeed - The type of item to feed

    • useFarmerItem

      public void useFarmerItem​(java.lang.String itemToUse)
      Calls gameEnv useFarmerItem and passes itemToUse. Then calls update main screen
      Parameters:
      itemToUse - The type of item to use

    • harvestCrops

      public void harvestCrops()
      Calls gameEnv harvestCrops. Then calls update main screen

    • tendFarmLand

      public void tendFarmLand()
      Calls gameEnv harvestCrops. Clears mainFieldFours description Then calls update main screen

    • tendCrop

      public void tendCrop()
      Tends Crops Gets cropArrayPostition by looping over actionButtons to see which is selected. gameEnviroments tendCrop with this value updates main screen

    • generateCropSubOptions

      public void generateCropSubOptions​(java.lang.String message)
      Populates the action buttons panel with radio buttons which represent the crops the user can tend to. Then update the message above the actions list
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be displayed

    • updateCropFarms

      public void updateCropFarms()
      Updates the crop farms Done by checking the number of crops in the farm, then for each crop on the farm, get the crop type, then updates the icon and description of the corresponding farm for those of the crop. Icon is dependent on crop growth If no crop for given farm, sets icon to dirt

    • gameEnd

      public void gameEnd()
      Processes Game end. Changes panel to gameEndPanel Sets gameEndUserName to getUserThanks from gameEnv Sets gameEndScoreTextPane to getScore from gameEnv Calls for gameEnv to delete saveFile

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Sets up game for game Restart by setting select fields. back to default values and changing visibility of certain panels

    • newGameSetup

      public void newGameSetup()
      Sets up panel visibility for new game.

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame()
      Calls gameEnv checkSaveFileExists to see if save-file exists It it does, calls loadGameFromSavefile, changes to main screen, and calls update main screen. Otherwise sets loadInErrorLabel to display false and disables loadGameButton

    • loadFromSaveFile

      public void loadFromSaveFile()
      Updates current to gameState returned from call to gameEnviroment loadFromSaveFile. Updates gameEnviroments gameState to this gameState
